attributes.action: Bring in compulsory registration for dog owners with a theory test on DDA
attributes.additional_details:
Create a theory test on the dangerous dogs act, which is required to pass to gain registration of each dog / owner based on section 2 & 3 of the DDA  

Linked to the microchip of the dog and the owner by address 

A fee required to gain registration based on the dogs weight - as seen in car tax / vehicle emissions, with a yearly fee to renew 

With a reported 11 million dogs currently living in the UK better education on how to keep dogs under control in everyday circumstances,
attributes.background:
It is my belief owners are not educated or aware of DDA and what constitutes a dog dangerously out of control 

Due  to this lack of knowledge a rise in dogs being out of control has led to human and animal injuries and fatalities

rejection.details: You may wish to sign: 'Bring back a Dog Licence' https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/643650
